IP.Name: KMS
IP.About: Key Management Services (KMS) provides cryptographic services through the standard PKCS#11 APIs (developed by OASIS) allowing to abstract the key value to the caller (using object ID and not directly the key value). KMS can be executed inside a protected/isolated environment in order to ensure that key value canâ€™t be accessed by an unauthorized code running outside the protected/isolated environment.

RefParameter.Name: KMS_EXT_TOKEN_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description: KMS_EXT_TOKEN_ENABLED : to support External Token

RefParameter.Name: KMS_NVM_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_NVM_ENABLED : to support Non Volatile Memory storage
Mandatory to handle runtime objects addition through blob import or creation through specific KMS services
Requires @ref KMS_NVM_SLOT_NUMBERS to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_NVM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED
RefParameter.Comment: support Dynamic Non Volatile Memory storage

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: only available when KMS support Non Volatile Memory storage (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) is defined & support Dynamic Volatile Memory storage (KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED) is not defined

RefParameter.Description:
KMS_NVM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED : to support Non Volatile Memory storage
Mandatory to handle runtime objects creation through specific KMS services
Requires "support Non Volatile Memory storage" (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_NVM_SLOT_NUMBERS
RefParameter.Comment: number of slots to use in the Non Volatile Memory storage

Condition.Diagnostic: Requires support Non Volatile Memory storage (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) to be defined

RefParameter.Description:
KMS_NVM_SLOT_NUMBERS : Specify here the number of slots to use in the Non Volatile Memory storage
NVM slots correspond to storage slots, it should be at least equal to the number of keys you'll store
into NVM. But if you intend to manipulate objects (create, destroy, derivate...) better use a greater
number to avoid too much erase of the flash sectors containing the NVM storage.
Memory impact is a 4 bytes per slot to store slot address in NVM.
Mandatory to set if "support Non Volatile Memory storage" (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) is defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: only available when KMS support Dynamic Non Volatile Memory storage (KMS_NVM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED) is not defined

RefParameter.Description:
KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED : to support Volatile Memory storage
Mandatory to handle runtime objects creation through specific KMS services

RefParameter.Name: KMS_VM_SLOT_NUMBERS
RefParameter.Comment: number of slots to use in the Volatile Memory storage

Condition.Diagnostic: Requires support Volatile Memory storage (KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED) to be defined

RefParameter.Description:
KMS_VM_SLOT_NUMBERS : Specify here the number of slots to use in the Volatile Memory storage
VM slots correspond to storage slots, it should be at least equal to the number of keys you'll store
into VM.
Memory impact is a 4 bytes per slot to store slot address in VM.
Mandatory to set if "support Non Volatile Memory storage" (KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED) is defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_NB_SESSIONS_MAX
RefParameter.Comment: number of sessions KMS will be able to handle in parallel
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_NB_SESSIONS_MAX : Defines the number of sessions KMS will be able to handle in parallel
This value has an impact on memory footprint

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ENCRYPT
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_ENCRYPT : to support encryption services
Requires a supported encryption algorithm to be enabled too:
- KMS_AES_CBC
- KMS_AES_CCM
- KMS_AES_ECB
- KMS_AES_GCM

RefParameter.Name: KMS_DECRYPT
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_DECRYPT : to support decryption services
Requires a supported decryption algorithm to be enabled too:
- KMS_AES_CBC
- KMS_AES_CCM
- KMS_AES_ECB
- KMS_AES_GCM

RefParameter.Name: KMS_DIGEST
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_DIGEST : to support digest services
Requires a supported digest algorithm to be enabled too:
- KMS_SHA1
- KMS_SHA256

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SIGN
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SIGN : to support signature services
Requires a supported signature algorithm to be enabled too:
- KMS_RSA1
- KMS_AES_CMAC

RefParameter.Name: KMS_VERIFY
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_VERIFY : to support verification services
Requires a supported verification algorithm to be enabled too:
- KMS_RSA1
- KMS_ECDSA
- KMS_AES_CMAC

RefParameter.Name: KMS_DERIVE_KEY
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_DERIVE_KEY : to support key derivation services
Requires a supported derivation algorithm to be enabled too:
- KMS_AES_ECB
Requires KMS_NVM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be enabled to store derived key into NVM
or @ref KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be enabled to store derived key into VM

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SEARCH
RefParameter.Comment: support key search or mechanism search services
RefParameter.Description: KMS_SEARCH : to support key search or mechanism search services

RefParameter.Name: KMS_GENERATE_KEYS
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_GENERATE_KEYS : to support key generation services
Requires a supported key generation algorithm to be enabled too:
- KMS_ECDSA
Requires KMS_NVM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be enabled to store generated key into NVM
or @ref KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be enabled to store generated key into VM

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ATTRIBUTES
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_ATTRIBUTES : to support attributes manipulation services
Requires @ref KMS_NVM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED or @ref KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be enabled
in order to modify attributes

RefParameter.Name: KMS_OBJECTS
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_OBJECTS : to support objects manipulation services
Requires KMS_NVM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be enabled to create or delete objects into NVM
or @ref KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be enabled to create or delete objects into VM

RefParameter.Name: KMS_PKCS11_GET_FUNCTION_LIST_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_PKCS11_GET_FUNCTION_LIST_SUPPORT : to support C_GetFunctionList API
Disabling this feature allows to save some code footprint

RefParameter.Name: KMS_PKCS11_COMPLIANCE
RefParameter.Comment: support PKCS11 APIs and implementation that are required to be compliant with PKCS11 standard
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_PKCS11_COMPLIANCE : to support PKCS11 APIs and implementation that are required
to be compliant with PKCS11 standard
Disabling this feature allows to save some code footprint

RefParameter.Name: KMS_NIKMS_ROUTER_BYPASS
RefParameter.Comment: bypass KMS router and perform direct KMS API calls
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_NIKMS_ROUTER_BYPASS : to bypass KMS router and perform direct KMS API calls
Only applicable when using 'niKMS' access
Enabling this feature allows to save some code footprint, but forbid any use of the external token services

RefParameter.Name: KMS_IMPORT_BLOB
RefParameter.Comment: use vendor defined blob import features
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_IMPORT_BLOB : to use vendor defined blob import features
Requires KMS_NVM_ENABLED to store imported keys
Requires the following services and algorithm to Authenticate, Verify and decrypt the imported blobs:
- KMS_DECRYPT
- KMS_AES_CBC
- KMS_DIGEST
- KMS_SHA256
- KMS_VERIFY
- KMS_ECDSA
- KMS_EC_SECP256

RefParameter.Name: KMS_IMPORT_BLOB_CHUNK_SIZE
RefParameter.Comment: Configure the blob importation chunk size
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_IMPORT_BLOB_CHUNK_SIZE : Configure the blob importation chunk size
- This size must be a multiple of 4
- This size must be greater to at least the blob import header size (@ref KMS_BlobRawHeaderTypeDef)
Requires KMS_IMPORT_BLOB to be enabled

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ENCRYPT_DECRYPT_BLOB
RefParameter.Comment: enable the encryption of the blobs within the KMS data storage
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_ENCRYPT_DECRYPT_BLOB : Enable the encryption of the blobs within the KMS data storage
Requires KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SECURE_COUNTERS
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SECURE_COUNTERS : to support KMS secure counters
Mandatory to handle counter objects through specific KMS services
Requires @ref KMS_NVM_ENABLED or @ref KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_MEM_USE_ALLOCATOR
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_MEM_USE_HEAP_ALLOCATOR : to perform dynamic allocation in HEAP
- KMS will use standard malloc and free APIs
- Requires a dynamic allocator provided by the toolchain like dlmalloc
KMS_MEM_USE_POOL_ALLOCATOR : to perform dynamic allocation using internal pool allocator
- Requires a pool definition in a file called kms_mem_pool_def.h (see kms_mem_pool_def_template.h for example)
KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR : to perform dynamic allocation using a custom allocator
To use this custom allocator, implement the kms_mem_low_level.c
- void KMS_MemInit(void)
- CK_VOID_PTR KMS_Alloc(CK_SESSION_HANDLE session, size_t size)
- void KMS_Free(CK_SESSION_HANDLE session, CK_VOID_PTR ptr)

RefParameter.Name: KMS_MEM_USE_HEAP_ALLOCATOR
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_MEM_USE_HEAP_ALLOCATOR : to perform dynamic allocation in HEAP
- KMS will use standard malloc and free APIs
- Requires a dynamic allocator provided by the toolchain like dlmalloc
KMS_MEM_USE_HEAP_ALLOCATOR, KMS_MEM_USE_POOL_ALLOCATOR and KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR are mutually exclusive

RefParameter.Name: KMS_MEM_USE_POOL_ALLOCATOR
RefParameter.Comment: perform dynamic allocation using internal pool allocator
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_MEM_USE_POOL_ALLOCATOR : to perform dynamic allocation using internal pool allocator
- Requires a pool definition in a file called kms_mem_pool_def.h (see kms_mem_pool_def_template.h for example)
KMS_MEM_USE_HEAP_ALLOCATOR, KMS_MEM_USE_POOL_ALLOCATOR and KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR are mutually exclusive

RefParameter.Name: KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR
RefParameter.Comment: perform dynamic allocation using custom allocator
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR : to perform dynamic allocation using a custom allocator
To use this custom allocator, implement the kms_mem_low_level.c
- void KMS_MemInit(void)
- CK_VOID_PTR KMS_Alloc(CK_SESSION_HANDLE session, size_t size)
- void KMS_Free(CK_SESSION_HANDLE session, CK_VOID_PTR ptr)
KMS_MEM_USE_HEAP_ALLOCATOR, KMS_MEM_USE_POOL_ALLOCATOR and KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR are mutually exclusive

RefParameter.Name: KMS_MEM_DEBUGGING

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Not usable when perform dynamic allocation using custom allocator (KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR)
Not usable when clean dynamically freed memory (KMS_MEM_CLEANING) & perform dynamic allocation in HEAP(KMS_MEM_USE_HEAP_ALLOCATOR)

RefParameter.Description:
KMS_MEM_DEBUGGING : to keep memory profiling information
Not usable with KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR

RefParameter.Name: KMS_MEM_CLEANING

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Not usable when perform dynamic allocation using custom allocator (KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR)

RefParameter.Description:
KMS_MEM_CLEANING : to clean dynamically freed memory
The freed memory will be reset to 0
If using KMS_MEM_USE_HEAP_ALLOCATOR, KMS_MEM_DEBUGGING required
Not usable with KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR

RefParameter.Name: KMS_MEM_LOGGING

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Not usable when perform dynamic allocation using custom allocator (KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR)

RefParameter.Description:
KMS_MEM_LOGGING : to log memory allocation information
Information about allocations will be transmitted to KMS_LL_ReportMemAlloc and KMS_LL_ReportMemFree
Not usable with KMS_MEM_USE_CUSTOM_ALLOCATOR

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SE_CHECK_PARAMS
RefParameter.Comment: check input & output parameters location vs secure enclave
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SE_CHECK_PARAMS : to check input & output parameters location vs secure enclave
Secure enforcement only applicable when using iKMS and secure enclave

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SE_LOCK_KEYS
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SE_CHECK_PARAMS : to use key locking services
Secure enforcement only applicable when using iKMS and secure enclave

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SE_LOCK_KEYS_MAX
RefParameter.Comment: the number of keys that can be locked
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SE_LOCK_KEYS_MAX : the number of keys that can be locked
Mandatory to set if KMS_SE_LOCK_KEYS is defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SE_LOCK_SERVICES
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SE_LOCK_SERVICES : to use services locking services
Secure enforcement only applicable when using iKMS and secure enclave

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SE_LOCK_SERVICES_MAX
RefParameter.Comment: the number of services that can be locked
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SE_LOCK_SERVICES_MAX : the number of services that can be locked
Mandatory to set if KMS_SE_LOCK_SERVICES is defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Encrypt_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: encryption service not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Encrypt_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate an algorithm to this service

Condition.Diagnostic: encryption service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Encrypt_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to an algorithm

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Decrypt_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: decryption service not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Decrypt_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate an algorithm to this service

Condition.Diagnostic: decryption service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Decrypt_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to an algorithm

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Derive_Key_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: key derivation service not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Derive_Key_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate an algorithm to this service

Condition.Expression: S_KMS_DERIVE_KEY & !(S_KMS_DERIVE_KEY_USED | S_KMS_ENCRYPT_DERIVE_KEY_USED | S_KMS_DECRYPT_DERIVE_KEY_USED | S_KMS_ENCRYPT_DECRYPT_DERIVE_KEY_USED | S_KMS_VERIFY_DERIVE_KEY_USED | S_KMS_GENERATE_KEY_DERIVE_KEY_USED | S_KMS_VERIFY_GENERATE_KEY_DERIVE_KEY_USED)
Condition.Diagnostic: key derivation service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Derive_Key_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to an algorithm

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Generate_Key_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: key generation service not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Generate_Key_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate an algorithm to this service

Condition.Diagnostic: key generation service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Generate_Key_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to an algorithm

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Sign_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: signature service not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Sign_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate an algorithm to this service

Condition.Diagnostic: signature service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Sign_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to an algorithm

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Verify_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: verification service not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Verify_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate an algorithm to this service

Condition.Diagnostic: verification service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Verify_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to an algorithm

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Digest_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: digest service not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Digest_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate an algorithm to this service

Condition.Diagnostic: digest service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ACTIVATED_Digest_Service
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to an algorithm

RefParameter.Name: KMS_AES_CBC
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_AES_CBC : to support AES CBC algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_ENCRYPT This algorithm can be used to perform encryption
- KMS_FCT_DECRYPT This algorithm can be used to perform decryption
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_ENCRYPT
- KMS_DECRYPT

RefParameter.Name: KMS_AES_CCM
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_AES_CCM : to support AES CCM algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_ENCRYPT This algorithm can be used to perform encryption
- KMS_FCT_DECRYPT This algorithm can be used to perform decryption
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_ENCRYPT
- KMS_DECRYPT

RefParameter.Name: KMS_AES_ECB
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_AES_ECB : to support AES ECB algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_ENCRYPT This algorithm can be used to perform encryption
- KMS_FCT_DECRYPT This algorithm can be used to perform decryption
- KMS_FCT_DERIVE_KEY This algorithm can be used to perform key derivation
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_ENCRYPT - KMS_DECRYPT
- KMS_DERIVE_KEY

RefParameter.Name: KMS_AES_GCM
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_AES_GCM : to support AES GCM algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_ENCRYPT This algorithm can be used to perform encryption
- KMS_FCT_DECRYPT This algorithm can be used to perform decryption
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_ENCRYPT
- KMS_DECRYPT

RefParameter.Name: KMS_AES_CMAC
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_AES_CMAC : to support AES CMAC algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_SIGN This algorithm can be used to perform signature
- KMS_FCT_VERIFY This algorithm can be used to perform verification
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_SIGN
- KMS_VERIFY

RefParameter.Name: KMS_RSA
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_RSA : to support RSA algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_SIGN This algorithm can be used to perform signature
- KMS_FCT_VERIFY This algorithm can be used to perform verification
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_SIGN
- KMS_VERIFY
Requires at least one of the following RSA modulus length to be enabled:
- KMS_RSA_1024
- KMS_RSA_2048

RefParameter.Name: KMS_RSA_Modulus
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: RSA algorithm not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_RSA_Modulus
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate a modulus to this algorithm

Condition.Diagnostic: signature service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_RSA_Modulus
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to a modulus

RefParameter.Name: KMS_RSA_1024
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_RSA_1024 : to support RSA 1024 bits modulus length
Requires KMS_RSA to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_RSA_2048
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_RSA_2048 : to support RSA 2048 bits modulus length
Requires KMS_RSA to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ECDSA
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_ECDSA Uncomment the below line to support ECDSA algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_VERIFY This algorithm can be used to perform verification
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_VERIFY
Requires at least one of the following elliptic curve to be enabled:
- KMS_EC_SECP192
- KMS_EC_SECP256
- KMS_EC_SECP384

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ECDSA_Elliptic_Curve
RefParameter.DefaultValue: not activated

Condition.Diagnostic: RSA algorithm not activated

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ECDSA_Elliptic_Curve
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please associate an ellictic curve to this algorithm

Condition.Diagnostic: signature service should be used by a feature

RefParameter.Name: KMS_ECDSA_Elliptic_Curve
RefParameter.DefaultValue: activated and associated to an ellictic curve

RefParameter.Name: KMS_EC_SECP192
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_EC_SECP192 : to support elliptic curve SECP-192
Requires KMS_ECDSA to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_EC_SECP256
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_EC_SECP256 : to support elliptic curve SECP-256
Requires KMS_ECDSA to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_EC_SECP384
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_EC_SECP384 : to support elliptic curve SECP-384
Requires KMS_ECDSA to be defined

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SHA1
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SHA1 : to support SHA1 algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_DIGEST This algorithm can be used to perform digesting
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_DIGEST

RefParameter.Name: KMS_SHA256
RefParameter.Description:
KMS_SHA256 : to support SHA256 algorithm
This defines is a bit mask that include information on the algorithm purpose:
- KMS_FCT_DIGEST This algorithm can be used to perform digesting
Requires at least one of the following PKCS#11 services to be enabled:
- KMS_DIGEST

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: only available when KMS support Dynamic Non Volatile Memory storage (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) or support Dynamic Volatile Memory storage (KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED) is defined
only available when KMS support Dynamic Non Volatile Memory storage (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) or support Dynamic Volatile Memory storage (KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED) is defined
only available when KMS support Dynamic Non Volatile Memory storage (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) or support Dynamic Volatile Memory storage (KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED) is defined

only available when KMS support Non Volatile Memory storage (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) is defined & AES CBC algorithm use decryption & SHA256 algorithm use digest & ECDSA algorithm with elliptic curve 256 use verification
only available when KMS use vendor defined blob import features (KMS_IMPORT_BLOB) is defined
only available when KMS support Dynamic Non Volatile Memory storage (KMS_NVM_ENABLED) or support Dynamic Volatile Memory storage (KMS_VM_DYNAMIC_ENABLED) is defined

only available if support encryption & decryption services
only available if support encryption services

only available if support encryption & decryption services
only available if support encryption services
only available if support decryption services
only available if support key derivation services
only available if support encryption & decryption services
only available if support encryption & key derivation services
only available if support decryption & key derivation services
only available if support encryption & decryption services
only available if support encryption services
only available if support decryption services
only available if support encryption & decryption services
only available if support signature services
only available if support verification services
only available if support signature & verification services
only available if support signature services
only available if support verification services
only available if support signature & verification services

only available when KMS support RSA algorithm (KMS_RSA) is defined

only available when KMS support ECDSA algorithm (KMS_ECDSA) for Verify services is defined
only available when KMS support ECDSA algorithm (KMS_ECDSA) for Verify services is defined
only available when KMS support ECDSA algorithm (KMS_ECDSA) for Verify services is defined
digest services is requested
digest services is requested

Condition.Diagnostic: not available if one of PKA or AES is already used
